options.title: -f, --file-system
options.description: display file system status instead of file status

options.title: -f, --file-system
options.description: display file system status instead of file status

options.title: --cached=MODE
options.description: specify how to use cached attributes; useful on remote file systems. See MODE below

options.title: -c --format=FORMAT
options.description: use the specified FORMAT instead of the default; output a newline after each use of FORMAT

options.title: --printf=FORMAT
options.description: like --format, but interpret backslash escapes, and do not output a mandatory trailing newline; if you want a newline, include \n in FORMAT

options.title: -t, --terse
options.description: print the information in terse form

options.title: -t, --terse
options.description: print the information in terse form
